ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]Sometimes your worst moments can turn into opportunities for growth #TEDTalks

ns2:group.ns2:title: Sometimes your worst moments can turn into opportunities for growth #TEDTalks
ns2:group.ns2:description: Cartoonist Liana Finck's drawings hold our hands through life's predicaments, big and small: dating, breakups, what to make for dinner, how to leave a party without being rude, how to think about our relationship with God. In a funny, moving talk, she shares some of her drawings and shows how she uses creativity to navigate false starts and cluelessness in the search for belonging.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Innovation with AWS: Working Backwards in Action | GenAI Customer Story | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Innovation with AWS: Working Backwards in Action | GenAI Customer Story | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Join AWS Principal Amay Lala to discover Amazon's systematic approach to innovation - from initial concept to real-world implementation. Learn how our proven Working Backwards methodology is evolving for the GenAI era, and see how one media organization used these principles to transform their sports broadcasting experience. Whether you're just stastarting your AI journey or looking to scale existing innovations, you'll leave with practical insights on driving customer-focused innovation in your organization.
Ready to start your innovation journey? Contact the AWS Digital Innovation team or reach out to your AWS account representative.
Subscribe to AWS: https://go.aws/subscribe
Create a free AWS account: https://go.aws/signup Try AWS for free: https://go.aws/free Connect with an expert: https://go.aws/contact Explore more: https://go.aws/more
Next steps: Explore on AWS in Analyst Research: https://go.aws/reports Discover, deploy, and manage software that runs on AWS: https://go.aws/marketplace Join the AWS Partner Network: https://go.aws/partners Learn more on how Amazon builds and operates software: https://go.aws/library
Do you have technical AWS questions? Ask the community of experts on AWS re:Post: https://go.aws/3lPaoPb
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud, enabling customers to build anything they can imagine. We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.
#AWS #WorkingBackwards #AWSInnovation #GenerativeAI #DigitalTransformation #AmazonWebServices #CloudComputing

ns2:group.ns2:title: Build Hour: Responses API
ns2:group.ns2:description:
The Responses API is our flagship API for building agents. This Build Hour shows how the Responses API unlocks persistent reasoning, hosted tools, and multimodal workflows for GPT-5.
Steve Coffey (API Engineering) covers: ‚Ä¢ How to use built-in tools, call multiple tools in one API request, and preserve reasoning tokens across turns ‚Ä¢ How the Responses API is faster and more cost-efficient ‚Ä¢ Live demo: building a simulator to bring a day in the life of an OpenAI engineer to life ‚Ä¢ Live Q&A
üëâ Follow along with the code repo: https://github.com/openai/build-hours üëâ Responses API Docs: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/responses üëâ Migrate to Responses API Guide: https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/migrate-to-responses üëâ Sign up for upcoming live Build Hours: https://webinar.openai.com/buildhours/

ns2:group.ns2:title: Google's gadgets, ranked | The Vergecast
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Google is on a bit of a heater when it comes to gadgets. The Pixel 10 lineup is one of the best Android phone options; the Pixel Watch 4 is suddenly a winner; the Pixel Buds are an excellent accessory; even the Pixel Fold got some welcome upgrades this year! With the help of The Verge‚Äôs Victoria Song and Allison Johnson, we do the impossible: we rank all six of Google‚Äôs Pixel gadgets, from worst to best. Are headphones better than smartphones? Can you really compare a tablet to a smartwatch? Who knows, but we try. After that, Allison and David answer a question from the Vergecast Hotline (call 866-VERGE11 or email vergecast@theverge.com!) about whether the dumbphone movement is a real one. #Vergecast #Podcast #Technology
0:00 Introduction and Nostalgia for the Pixel Book 00:21 Google's Good Gadgets Overview 01:07 Meet the Team and Their Reviews 02:02 Google Pixel 10 Pro Fold Review 07:41 Pixel Watch and Pixel Buds Reviews 13:42 Ranking Google's Gadgets 14:51 Interactive Gadget Ranking Game 25:31 Ranking the Top Three Google Gadgets 27:33 Pixel vs Samsung: User Experience 28:14 Ranking the Pixel: A Debate 31:17 Pixel Watch vs Apple Watch 35:56 Final Rankings: Google's Best Products 47:21 Hotline Question: Are Other People Switching to the Light Phone? 48:25 The Future of Phones: Minimalism and Smartwatches 57:19 Closing Thoughts

ns2:group.ns2:title: EnergySys scales its data management services globally with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Mark Truman, CEO at EnergySys, shares how the company modernizes data management by helping customers leverage complex and critical data sets efficiently and securely. As a cloud-native solution, the business is freeing oil and gas providers from legacy systems that are complex to manage, slow to implement, and expensive.
Since migrating to AWS, EnergySys benefits from improved SaaS features, freeing up time for engineers to focus on building better solutions for customers. Powered by AWS, EnergySys has broadened its reach within the industry, driving growth, profitability, and operational excellence globally. Discover how EnergySys scaled seamlessly on AWS.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]How Bango fueled flexible, scalable cloud migration with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: How Bango fueled flexible, scalable cloud migration with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Bango is a leading player in payments and subscription bundling. Its core product, the Digital Vending Machine¬Æ, brings together telcos, banks, retailers, and other consumer businesses to bundle subscription services for customers.
When building its all-in-one solution, Bango needed to rapidly modernize its infrastructure. And after acquiring another company, the business wanted to unite its disparate data and scale to support larger volumes of traffic. After using AWS for this rapid replatforming journey, Bango has been able to grow its product offering in ways that were previously unimaginable. Technical complexity is now a thing of the past, and the Bango team can focus on delivering different capabilities, reaching new regions faster, and strengthening service quality.
Learn how software companies can simplify cloud migration and modernization here: http://go.aws/3WnFzjn

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Mimecast‚Äôs AI solution helps mitigate human risk with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Mimecast‚Äôs AI solution helps mitigate human risk with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
AI-powered cybersecurity company Mimecast supports end-to-end protection against human risk. By training models on decades of security data and multiple inferencing factors, it‚Äôs able to analyze digital communications and spot patterns in 200 milliseconds.
Mimecast collaborated closely with AWS to co-build and launch its sophisticated products. Using Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock, the software company can seamlessly scale solutions and operate hundreds of deep learning models at the same time to support over 42,000 customers. Watch to find out how Mimecast uses AI to help identify nuanced patterns in human behavior.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Matillion uses AI to transform data into human friendly insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Matillion uses AI to transform data into human friendly insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Data is the foundation of any modern business. And while most companies can‚Äôt function without it, many don‚Äôt have the tools or know-how to unleash its true potential. Matillion harnesses the power of generative AI to transform complex, unstructured data into understandable outputs in a way that is timely and cost-effective.
Julian Wiffen, Chief of AI at Matillion, explains how the software company leveraged Amazon Bedrock to build and continuously improve its agentic AI system. The platform works in two ways: by transforming different forms of complex data to reveal new gems of insight; and by empowering any user to build sophisticated data pipelines using natural language. By tackling complex technical challenges with AWS, Matillion can now support multiple languages, opening up new markets and opportunities.
Moving forward, Matillion has the means to keep unlocking greater accuracy, speed, and cost efficiency for its customers.
Find out more about how software companies can gain the freedom to build, scale, and grow with AWS: http://go.aws/3WnFzjn

ns2:group.ns2:description:
We‚Äôre living in a golden age of affordable mechanical keyboards. Boards with great features, nice typing feel, and satisfying sounds can now be had pre-built for just $100-ish instead of the $300-plus they used to run. Here's a quick review of eight different mechs that are as much a treat for your ears as your fingers.

Description: See how Epsilon, a subsidiary of Publicis Groupe, enhanced their marketing campaign automation using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore. Learn how they deployed an AI-powered campaign orchestration system that reduced setup time by 30%, increased personalization capacity by 20%, and scaled campaign creation by 20% while saving teams 8 hours per week.
Discover how AgentCore's comprehensive suite of services enabled Epsilon to automate content creation, campaign design, and real-time optimization across multiple channels, setting new standards for AI-driven customer engagement.
Learn more: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore: https://go.aws/4nJmvrP AgentCore Documentation: https://go.aws/48r5w8K Getting started with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore: https://go.aws/473vtZC AgentCore Resources: https://go.aws/473E9iG

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]Will Climate Change Make Your Home Uninsurable? | Amy Barnes | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: Will Climate Change Make Your Home Uninsurable? | Amy Barnes | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Insurance is the hidden engine that keeps the economy churning, but climate change is making home insurance unaffordable for many people, says climate risk advisor Amy Barnes. She reveals why soaring premiums aren't just bad news for homeowners, but also a flashing red signal for the global financial system ‚Äî and why investing in resilience now could change everything. (Recorded at TED Countdown Summit 2025 on June 17, 2025)
Join us in person at a TED conference: https://tedtalks.social/events Become a TED Member to support our mission: https://ted.com/membership Subscribe to a TED newsletter: https://ted.com/newsletters

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Beyond the First Build: Will's Vision | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Beyond the First Build: Will's Vision | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Meet Will Horn, founder of global business needs agency (gdna), who is reshaping how companies think about early career talent in the AI era. After discovering Brian Rowe's AWS cloud learning journey https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6TeYwoDgaBA, Will saw an opportunity to create meaningful pathways for emerging tech professionals.
In this executive perspective from our "Beyond the First Build" series, Will shares insights about how AI is transforming entry-level tech roles and why investing in early career talent is crucial for innovation. Learn about gdna's unique approach to developing new builders and hear Will's vision for the future of tech careers.
Watch as Will discusses the evolving technology landscape, the importance of creating psychological safety for learning, and how companies can build successful early career talent programs in the age of AI.
Watch Brian's journey at gdna: https://youtu.be/lgWftKUWdfw
Ready to start your builder journey? Join AWS Builder Center, where you can connect with builders who understand your journey, share solutions, and access content that accelerates your growth: https://go.aws/3L8YZ8U

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Beyond the First Build: Deepti's Path to AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Beyond the First Build: Deepti's Path to AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
In this inspiring follow-up story, we revisit Deepti Trivedi, who we first met as an Associate Technology Strategist exploring cloud computing opportunities [link to previous video]. Since then, Deepti has advanced her career to become a Support Engineer at AWS, where she helps organizations solve complex technical challenges.
Watch as Deepti shares insights about her technical evolution, career transitions, and the continuous learning mindset that drives her success. Learn how she navigates the dynamic world of cloud computing and hear her advice for others considering a career in tech.
This video is part of our "Beyond the First Build" series, showcasing how cloud skills can lead to dynamic career opportunities and meaningful professional growth. Join us as we explore Deepti's journey of continuous learning and achievement in the tech industry.
Watch Deepti's original story: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vaPnGlvfMv0

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Beyond the First Build: Brian's Tech Journey | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Beyond the First Build: Brian's Tech Journey | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
In this inspiring follow-up story, we revisit Brian Rowe, who we first met during his cloud learning journey with AWS Educate. Since then, Brian's dedication to building cloud skills has led to remarkable opportunities, including an internship that evolved into a full-time role as a Business Catalyst at global business needs agency (gdna).
Watch as Brian shares how his initial steps in cloud computing opened doors to a meaningful tech career, transforming challenges into opportunities. Learn how he applies his technical knowledge in business-focused roles, and hear his advice for others who might think a career in tech is out of reach.
This video is part of our "Beyond the First Build" series, showcasing how cloud skills can lead to dynamic career opportunities and meaningful professional growth. Join us as we explore Brian's continued journey of resilience, learning, and success in the tech industry.
Watch Brian's original story: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6TeYwoDgaBA

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [OpenAI]OpenAI x Broadcom ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 8

ns2:group.ns2:title: OpenAI x Broadcom ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 8
ns2:group.ns2:description:
OpenAI and Broadcom are teaming up to design our own chips‚Äîbringing lessons from building frontier models straight into the hardware. In partnership with Broadcom and alongside our other partners, we‚Äôre creating the next generation of AI infrastructure to meet the world‚Äôs growing demand.
In this episode, OpenAI‚Äôs Sam Altman and Greg Brockman sit down with Broadcom‚Äôs Hock Tan and Charlie Kawwas to announce a new partnership focused on custom AI chips and systems that could redefine what‚Äôs possible in computing.
Chapters 00:00 Announcing the partnership 03:06 The scale of AI infrastructure 06:03 Collaboration and innovation in chip design 08:49 Historical context and future vision 12:10 Role of compute in AI development 15:01 Optimizing for specific workloads 18:02 Journey towards AGI 21:00 Future of AI and compute capacity 23:50 Wrap-up and future projects
